articles.title: 3 Reasons to Sell CSCO and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

articles.summary: StockStory: 3 Reasons to Sell CSCO and 1 Stock to Buy Instead. Cisco has followed the market’s trajectory closely, rising in tandem with the S&P 500 over the past six months. The stock has climbed by 14.2% to $77.85 per share while the index has gained 13.3%. Related tickers mentioned: ^GSPC.

articles.title: Nvidia Absorbs Another Rival for $20B, Boosting Decentralized AI
articles.mainIdea: Nvidia Absorbs Another Rival for $20B, Boosting Decentralized AI
articles.summary: BeInCrypto: Nvidia Absorbs Another Rival for $20B, Boosting Decentralized AI. Nvidia pays $20B for Groq's AI chip assets, continuing its pattern of absorbing rivals and strengthening the case for decentralized alternatives. Related tickers mentioned: BLK, GOOG, GROQ.PVT, NVDA, SSNLF.

articles.title: Nvidia Licenses Groq’s AI Technology as Demand for Cutting-Edge Chips Grows
articles.mainIdea: Nvidia Licenses Groq’s AI Technology as Demand for Cutting-Edge Chips Grows
articles.summary: The Wall Street Journal: Nvidia Licenses Groq’s AI Technology as Demand for Cutting-Edge Chips Grows. Nvidia has forged a licensing deal with the chip startup Groq for its AI-inference technology, the companies said Wednesday, a sign of growing demand for cutting-edge AI chips. Under the nonexclusive deal, Groq’s chief executive officer and founder, Jonathan Ross, will be joining Nvidia, along with its president and some of the startup’s staff. Groq’s “language processing unit” chips are built for inference, the everyday process that occurs when consumers or businesses ask trained AI models to provide answers, make predictions or draw conclusions on new data. Related tickers mentioned: GROQ.PVT, NVDA.
